common_issues.title: PiecesOS Startup and Account Linking Issues
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS getting stuck during startup on the "dependencies scenario" screen, across Windows and MacOS.  Suggested workarounds include waiting, restarting, reinstalling, and checking log files. A potential fix was released with version 11.1.1.  Separately, users experience difficulty linking both Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously, with only one remaining active at a time.  This longstanding issue is linked to email capitalization inconsistencies and a legacy account linking system. A new system is planned for future release.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points:**

* User johnkennyuk is experiencing an issue with linking their GitHub and Google accounts in the Pieces app. 
* The account linking flow is currently not working properly and is being replaced.
* There is a potential issue with capitalization differences in user emails causing the linking issue.

**Problems identified:**

* Existing account linking flow is not up to par.
* Potential inconsistency with user emails due to capitalization.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mark, a member of the Pieces team, offered to manually merge the accounts for johnkennyuk.
* User email was corrected, but capitalization difference remains as a possible issue.
* New account linking service will be implemented by the end of February 2025.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Account linking remains unresolved due to capitalization difference and potential issues with the current service.
* User johnkennyuk will wait for the implementation of the new account linking service.

**Main highlights:**

* User experienced account linking issue.
* Mark offered help and identified possible causes.
* New account linking service is being rolled out in February.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS won't run
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS won't run
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Cannot launch Pieces for Developers.  The launcher can't find PiecesOS.  If try to launch PiecesOS from the Pieces Suite it says its already running.  I don't see it in the Systray.  I've Repairing, Resetting, and Reinstalling.
## GitHub conversation summary

**Key points raised:**
* User JasonDWilson reported issues with Pieces and the bot suggested relevant resources.
* Mark from pieces-app identified a related ticket and suggested debugging steps.

**Problems identified:**
* JasonDWilson experienced problems using Pieces but didn't specify details. 

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**
* The bot directed JasonDWilson to related resources and a previously reported bug.
* Mark provided a link to the related bug and suggested specific steps for debugging.
* The issue reported by JasonDWilson was closed.

**Current status/outcome:**
* JasonDWilson was directed toward resources and additional troubleshooting steps.
* The reported issue was closed, indicating the problem may be solved or requires further follow-up on JasonDWilson's end.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* **Issue:** PiecesOS gets stuck on the "dependencies scenario" tab and never progresses. This issue is affecting both Shamas Habib (Windows) and rogierlegit (MacOS).
* **Troubleshooting Steps:**
    * Pieces support team tried to troubleshoot the issue by recommending:
        * Waiting for the migration to complete (up to a couple minutes)
        * Restarting the PiecesOS Desktop application
        * Providing user logs
        * Running the appInstaller build instead of the standard installer
        * Uninstalling and reinstalling the app
        * Checking certain files in the program directory
    * Shamas Habib reinstalled Windows and tried AtlasOS, but the issue persisted.
    * rogierlegit waited 18 hours, but the issue did not resolve.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS gets stuck on the "dependencies scenario" tab.
* The issue persists even after multiple troubleshooting steps.
* The root cause of the issue is unclear.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces support team recommended several troubleshooting steps (see above).
* A new build (version 11.1.1) was released to address the issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Shamas Habib confirmed that the issue is resolved with version 11.1.1.
* rogierlegit reported that the issue is still ongoing after upgrading to version 11.1.1.

**Additional Notes:**
* The issue seems to be affecting both Windows and MacOS users.
* The issue appears to be related to the migration of data from the previous PiecesOS stack to the new stack.
* The root cause of the issue is still under investigation.


## Overall, the conversation highlights the following:

* **PiecesOS is currently experiencing an issue with migration to the new stack.**
* **The issue appears to be affecting a number of users, regardless of operating system.**
* **The issue is not yet fully resolved.**
* **The Pieces support team is actively working to resolve the issue.**


It is recommended to keep an eye on the issue thread for updates and follow the advice from the Pieces support team.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS fails to boot after update
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS getting stuck during startup after updating, often on the "dependencies scenario" screen. Suggested solutions include waiting for migration, restarting the application, reinstalling, or upgrading to the latest version. The issue appears to affect both Windows and MacOS users.

related_issues.title: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0
related_issues.text: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0 If you cannot open PiecesOS after updating to 11.1.0 and you are on an arm Machine M1, M2, M3,...etc then it is likely that you accidentally installed the intel version of the application. If you are Unsure. Please uninstall Pieces OS from your applications folder and reinstall from https://docs.pieces.app/installation-getting-started/macos (Arm == Apple Silicon) You can tell if you are working with Arm architecture if you see something that resembles this within your 'About this Mac' If you are still having issues after trying these steps please feel free to add a comment on this issue and schedule a time on my calendar here. https://calendar.app.google/MGd9i5gELtiDjWZm8 No comments found on this issue.

common_issues.title: Pieces App Bugs and Feature Requests
common_issues.description: Users reported issues with Pieces OS and Desktop App, including account linking problems and requests for French localization. Solutions involved bug fixes, feature development, and user support through debugging steps and resource guidance.

related_issues.title: Feat: Localization(french) for the Desktop Application
related_issues.text:
Feat: Localization(french) for the Desktop Application
### Software

Release Notes (code.pieces.app/updates)

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

win 10

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

pieces for developers .....need out in french ,,,,,, where ???
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Localizing Pieces App

**Key Points Raised:**
* User (@CryptoIngenieur1) requested localization support for the Pieces app and products.

**Problems Identified:**
* Pieces app currently lacks localization support, limiting its accessibility to users who may not understand the current language(s).

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**
* The Pieces team acknowledged the need for localization and is conducting research on implementing it.

**Current Status/Outcome:**
* No concrete timeline for implementation has been announced, but the team will update the issue as progress is made.

**Additional Notes:**
* The issue was opened on January 31, 2025, and received a response from the Pieces team on February 5, 2025. 
* The team is actively exploring localization options and will keep users informed about progress.

common_issues.title: Ollama Installation and Access Issues
common_issues.description: Users report failures downloading, installing, and accessing Ollama across Windows and Linux. This is likely due to Pieces OS version compatibility, missing dependencies in the Snap package, and sandbox environment restrictions. Proposed solutions include updating Pieces OS, adding dependencies like 'curl', and adjusting sandbox permissions.

related_issues.title: Models Download Fail
related_issues.text:
Models Download Fail
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

[log-02022025.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18631166/log-02022025.txt)

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8e93857a-de7e-4e62-b3d0-c6a68b48631e
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Issue:** Ollama installation failure

**Key Points:**

* User `surya-sengupta` reported Ollama installation failure.
* Support bot linked related issues and resources.
* Brian from Pieces team suggested updating to OS version 11.1.0 for stability improvements.

**Problems Identified:**

* Ollama installation failure, potentially due to instability issues.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* User is advised to update and retry the Ollama download. 
* The conversation ends with a suggestion to update, leaving the outcome uncertain. 
* Further updates or user responses are needed to determine the final resolution.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points:**

* The issue is with Pieces-OS, specifically with the inability to install the Ollama language model.
* This is due to Pieces-OS being a Snap package, which runs in a sandboxed environment without `curl` installed.
* The user attempted manual installation of Ollama, but this was unsuccessful due to the sandbox environment.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces-OS Snap package lacks the `curl` dependency, preventing installation of Ollama.
* Sandboxed environment restricts access to external executables like Ollama.
* The issue impacts both downloading and inference of local LLM models.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Add `curl` to the list of dependency packages in the Pieces-OS Snap definition file.
* Patch Pieces-OS to allow access to Ollama within the sandbox environment.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The fix is still in development, with the developer aiming to include it in the next release.
* Users are currently unable to download or run local LLM models due to the issue.

**Additional Notes:**

* Users have expressed urgency for a solution, emphasizing concerns over using cloud-based LLMs due to privacy concerns.

**Next Steps:**

* Monitor the issue for updates and deployment of the fix.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Launch and Connection Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties launching Pieces OS or connecting to localhost. Issues range from application launch failures to error messages related to PiecesWebSocketCreator and port accessibility. Troubleshooting steps include verifying installation, checking system requirements, and ensuring proper port configuration.

related_issues.title: Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
related_issues.text:
Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
Error: Bad state: GetIt: Object/factory with type PiecesWebSocketCreator is not registered inside GetIt. 
(Did you accidentally do GetIt sl=GetIt.instance(); instead of GetIt sl=GetIt.instance;
Did you forget to register it?)

**Installation Details**

Succeeded: false
Path: 

**PiecesOS Information**

ID: 4c9e86c3-7cd9-4905-84a3-be29a48a5a26
User: Anonymous
Current Version: Unknown
Min Version Supported: 11.0.4
Max Version Supported: 12.0.0
Local Port: 39301

**Device Information**

Operating System: Linux
Current Version: Linux 6.8.0-50-generic #51-Ubuntu SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Sat Nov  9 17:58:29 UTC 2024
Min Version Supported: Ubuntu 18
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User @Nagarajan2004 reported an issue with being unable to open the Pieces Copilot Service.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the appropriate team member.
* The user was provided with links to related issues and helpful resources.

**Problems Identified:**

* The user was unable to open the Pieces Copilot Service.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The issue was routed to the appropriate team member for investigation and resolution.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is currently being investigated by the Pieces team.
* The user is awaiting a follow-up within 24 hours.

**Note:**

* The conversation does not provide any further information about the specific problem or the proposed solutions. 
* More information will be available once the Pieces team investigates the issue.

recommendations: **Prioritize PiecesOS Boot-up Issues:** Focus on resolving the issue where PiecesOS gets stuck during startup, especially after updates. This appears to be a significant pain point affecting both Windows and MacOS users.

**Improve Account Linking:** Address the longstanding issue of users being unable to link both Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. This recurring problem hinders user experience and necessitates a permanent solution.

**Investigate Ollama Installation Failures:** Troubleshoot and resolve the problems users face when downloading and installing Ollama, particularly on Linux. This includes addressing dependency issues within the Snap package and sandbox environment restrictions.

**Address Localhost Connection Errors:** Investigate and resolve the error preventing users from opening localhost, which appears to be related to port accessibility and PiecesWebSocketCreator. Ensure clear documentation and troubleshooting steps for port configuration.

**Monitor Pieces OS Launch Issues:** Continue monitoring reports of Pieces OS launch failures and connection problems. Gather detailed logs and user feedback to identify patterns and potential solutions.

**Proactive Communication:**  Keep users informed about the status of known issues, particularly the PiecesOS boot-up and account linking problems. Provide clear timelines for fixes and workarounds whenever possible.

**Enhance Documentation:** Improve documentation regarding Pieces OS installation, configuration, and troubleshooting. Include specific instructions for resolving common issues like Ollama installation failures and localhost connection errors.

**Gather User Feedback:** Implement a system for collecting user feedback on support interactions and product experience. This will provide valuable insights for further improving support operations and product development.
